summary: This is a press release from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, announcing the death of Jeffrey Epstein in his cell at the Manhattan Correctional Center. The statement confirms the ongoing investigation into the sex trafficking charges and urges victims and witnesses to come forward.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: Issued the official statement on the death of Jeffrey Epstein, confirming the event and reiterating the office's commitment to the ongoing investigation and support for victims.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The accused in the sex trafficking of minors case, found unresponsive in his cell at the Manhattan Correctional Center and pronounced dead.

connections.description: Berman, as the U.S. Attorney, was the lead prosecutor overseeing the federal case against Epstein for sex trafficking of minors.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at the Manhattan Correctional Center and was pronounced dead shortly thereafter.

events.title: Ongoing Federal Investigation
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office confirms its investigation into the sex trafficking conspiracy charges against Epstein remains ongoing despite his death.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his cell at the Manhattan Correctional Center on the morning of August 9, 2019.
Epstein was facing federal charges of sex trafficking of minors, which included a conspiracy count.
The U.S. Attorney's Office stated the investigation into the conduct charged in the indictment remains ongoing.
The statement directly addresses and urges 'brave young women' who are victims or have information to contact the FBI.
The document frames Epstein's death as a potential hurdle to providing victims their day in court.
